definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: When ambient temperature is lower than 0℃, The setting rate of SSLD Wille be decreased.
sentences.chinese: 当温度低于0℃时，前者的硬化速度明显降低。

sentences.english: They keep horses and cattle, the former for riding, the latter for food.
sentences.chinese: 他们养着马和牛，前者供乘骑，后者供食用。

sentences.english: If the former, what is the plan for the company?
sentences.chinese: 如果是前者的话，公司有没什么计划？

sentences.english: The former now has more skyscrapers than the latter.
sentences.chinese: 前者如今拥有的摩天大楼比后者还多。

sentences.english: Joan and Jane are sisters. The former is a pianist; the latter is a singer.
sentences.chinese: 琼和简是姐妹，前者是钢琴家，后者是歌手。

sentences.english: The light of a candle is dimmed by electric light.
sentences.chinese: 烛光与电灯光相比，前者就显得暗淡无光了。

sentences.english: But I think the former happiness, because does not use in the withstanding pain.
sentences.chinese: 但是我认为前者幸福因为不用在承受痛苦。

sentences.english: The former expects the condition to always be true while the latter expects the two values to be mismatched.
sentences.chinese: 前者期望条件总是成立，而后者期望两个值不匹配。

sentences.english: One's going to be a power plant, and one is a distributed resource.
sentences.chinese: 前者将成为发电厂，后者是一种分散式资源。

sentences.english: This break a lap, the former is a prerequisite for the latter.
sentences.chinese: 这一破一立，前者是后者的前提条件。

sentences.english: Indeed, we should note just how prescient the latter have been.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我们应该注意到，前者是多么有先见之明。

sentences.english: The two ancient positions will be represented by Plato and Aristotle, the two modern positions by Immanuel Kant and John Stuart Mill.
sentences.chinese: 前者是柏拉图和亚里斯多德，后者是康德与约翰弥尔。

sentences.english: The good news is that there are many Chinese who want the former.
sentences.chinese: 而好消息是，在中国还是有不少人喜欢前者的。

sentences.english: The former is an equity issue and is highly political.
sentences.chinese: 前者是一个股权问题，并且政治色彩较重。

sentences.english: The former are considered to be homologous with the sepals of Ranunculus.
sentences.chinese: 普通认为，前者的花瓣与毛茛属植物花萼同源。

sentences.english: She hated Simpson, even though she handed her the crown.
sentences.chinese: 尽管辛普森让她头顶皇冠，她依然对前者耿耿于怀。

definition: and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
in fact/in reality/as a matter of fact/in practice
clearly and easy to see (idiom); obviously/clearly/it goes without saying
